options.name: Elemental Ammocrafter
options.description: Gain Access to Elemental Ammocrafting. You can use Beginner and Novice Level Catalysts in your Elemental Ammocrafter Recipes.

options.name: Double Infused Ammunition
options.description: When you Infuse Ammunition with both an Elemental Infusion and the cooresponding Area Infusion (Shocking,Shockwave,Burning,Frosted) of the same Subschool, the Primary Damage is negated, but everyone within the Area takes the Elemental Damage as Splash Damage.

options.name: Action : Purify Elements
options.description: You fire a piece of Ammunition with the Elemental Infusion on it, converting all of the Primary Damage to the Damage Type of your Infusion.

options.name: Action : Lineshot
options.description: You fire a piece of Ammunition Infused with one of the Area Infusions (Shocking,Shockwave,Burning,Frosted), converting them into a Line with a Radius of 1 Unit and Length equal to your Ammocraft Modifier at the time of Crafting. Additionally, the Area persists until the end of your next turn, causing any Creature who moves through the affected Area to have to make the Check against the effects again.

options.name: Critical Elemental Infusion
options.description: On True Hits, the Dice for the Secondary Damage on your Elemental Infusions are doubled, including usages of Double Infused Ammuntion.

options.name: Improved Elemental Ammocraft
options.description: Gain +1 Ammocraft. Additionally, you can use Journeyman Catalysts in your Elemental Ammocraft Recipes at Level 7 and Expert at Level 9.
